API Reference for the oct-cbort package

oct¶

post¶

Post()

A post-processing object for managing pipeline of OCT processing after acquisition

load¶

data¶

Load(directory, *args, **kwargs)

Check directory contents and create corresponding dataset

Dataset([mode])

Creates a dataset ready to be processed, from metadata and fringe data

BoumaDataset(directory[, df])

Load metadata for Bouma format data

VakocDataset(directory[, df])

Load metadata for Vakoc format data

fringe¶

Fringe([mode])

Load fringe data from a .ofd file

metadata¶

Metadata()

Store all the metadata loaded during initialization

reconstruct¶

tomogram¶

Tomogram([mode])

Tomogram reconstruction for OCT

structure¶

Structure([mode])

Structure contrast OCT reconstruction

angiography¶

Angiography([mode])

Angiography contrast OCT reconstruction

polarization¶

Polarization([mode])

Polarization contrast OCT reconstruction

write¶

writer¶

Writer()

A writing object for saving processed images as they are reconstructed

view¶

colormap¶

Colormap([cmapLabel])

Generate an rgb frame from a greyscale using a chosen colormap

projection¶

Project()

A projecting object for appending inter-aline projections

processed¶

Processed()

A class used to load and save already processed datasets (or image files) in .mgh,.tif,.h5 or .mat format

mgh¶

MGHView(directory, state)

A modified viewer and labeller for .mgh files built on a napari viewer

ofd¶

OFDView(directory, state)

A real time viewer for .ofd files built on a napari viewer

gui¶

run_process_gui¶

MainWindow()

Main window of simple processing dispatcher gui

utils¶

utils¶

checkForCupy()

Master function for checking if cupy exists.

normalizeData(mat)

Returned data normalized between 0 and 1

str2bool(v)

Converts a string to boolean

closestDividableNumber(n, m)

Finds the second closest perfectly divisable number :param n: number to be divided :type n: int :param m: number that divides :type m: int

nextPowerOf2(x)

Return data to the next power of 2 :param n: number in proximity :type n: int

rotCartesianInterp(image[, polarIndex, …])

Rotate rectangular b-scans into cartesian circular bscans for endoscopic data

showProcessedData(data, processer[, zrange, …])

Quick and easy way to view all the processed data contrasts.

psUtils¶

stokes(tomch1, tomch2)

Compute stokes vectors from complex tomograms

unweaveInputPolarizations(S0, S1, S2, S3)

Unweave the modulated input polarizations from stokes vectors

filtNormStokes(SV1, SV2[, stokesFilter])

Filter and normalize stokes vectors

constructOrthonormal(SVN1, SVN2[, complete])

Construct orthonormal tripod from the two input polarization states stokes vectors

computeDOP(SV1, SV2, QUV1, QUV2)

Compute DOP from filtered and non-filtered data

applyRotation(MM, rotMatrix)

Rotates a measurement matrix by a rotation vector Notes: :param MM: Measurement matrix ([3,3,Nz,Alines,Bins]) :type MM: array :param rotVector: Rotation vector array ([3,3,Bins]) :type rotVector: array

getSymmetryCorrection(MM, dop)

Obtain a rotation matrix that can be applied to make the measurement matrix symmetric Notes: :param MM: Measurement matrix ([3,3,Nz,Alines,Bins]) :type MM: array :param dop: Degree of polarization ([3,3,Nz,Alines,Bins]) :type dop: array

getBinCorrection(MM, dop)

Obtain a rotation matrix that can be applied to align the spectral bins of the measurement matrix to reduce PMD

getCorrectionArray(sv1, sv2[, stokesFilter])

Compute the system compensating rotation matrix

makeRotationMatrix(rotVector)

Converts rotation vector into 3x3 rotation matrix Notes:

makeMeasurementMatrix(SV1, SV2[, stokesFilter])

Generate Measurement matrix from raw stokes vectors

makeJonesMatrix(self, retardance[, …])

Jones Matrix of a retarder.

decomposeRot(MM[, exact])

Decomposes the rotation matrix into the corresponding retardation vector

decomposeCorrection(correctionMatrix)

At the present state, sums the rotational matrices found during PS system characterization. .. note::.

decomposeJonesMatrix(Jmat)

Decompose 2x2 Jones matrix to retardance and diattenuation vectors

unwrapCorrection(rotCorr[, wrap])

Unwrap correction matrix across spectral bins .
